intro: Sida lonchitis, commonly known as the narrowleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are typically narrow and lance-shaped. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Sida lonchitis is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
